channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Houthi missile strike at Israel airport halts flights ahead of key vote on Gaza war
item.description: Israel said it would retaliate after four people were injured and flights temporarily suspended.
item.content:encoded:
Israel said it would retaliate after four people were injured and flights temporarily suspended.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How this teen fled Russian occupation to become an unassuming hero in Ukraine
item.description: An 18-year-old from Russian-occupied Luhansk tells NPR how and why he escaped to Kyiv.
item.content:encoded:
An 18-year-old from Russian-occupied Luhansk tells NPR how and why he escaped to Kyiv.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Lady Gaga rocks Copacabana Beach with a free concert for more than 2 million fans
item.description: "Tonight, we're making history. (...) Thank you for making history with me," Lady Gaga told a screaming crowd.
item.content:encoded:
"Tonight, we're making history. (...) Thank you for making history with me," Lady Gaga told a screaming crowd.

(Image credit: Silvia Izquierdo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Mexico's president says she rejected Trump's plan to send US troops across the border
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said Saturday that U.S. President Donald Trump proposed sending American troops into Mexico to help her administration fight drug trafficking but she rejected it.
item.content:encoded:
Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said Saturday that U.S. President Donald Trump proposed sending American troops into Mexico to help her administration fight drug trafficking but she rejected it.

(Image credit: Marco Ugarte)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The Vatican installs chimney to signal the selection of the next pope
item.description: Ahead of the election of the next pope, a chimney was installed atop the Sistine Chapel on Friday, which will help notify the public of the 267th pope.
item.content:encoded: Ahead of the election of the next pope, a chimney was installed atop the Sistine Chapel on Friday, which will help notify the public of the 267th pope.
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Sovereignty beats out favorite Journalism to win the Kentucky Derby
item.description: The victory hands Venezuelan jockey Junior Alvarado his first career win in the Kentucky Derby. Sovereignty's trainer, Bill Mott, has won the Kentucky Derby once before.
item.content:encoded:
The victory hands Venezuelan jockey Junior Alvarado his first career win in the Kentucky Derby. Sovereignty's trainer, Bill Mott, has won the Kentucky Derby once before.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Florida lawmakers try to balance condo safety with cost
item.description: Florida lawmakers have sent the governor a bill that would provide financial relief to condo owners. The measure softens mandates passed after the deadly 2021 collapse of a condo tower in Surfside.
item.content:encoded:
Florida lawmakers have sent the governor a bill that would provide financial relief to condo owners. The measure softens mandates passed after the deadly 2021 collapse of a condo tower in Surfside.

(Image credit: Lynne Sladky)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Actress and 'Laugh-In' comedian Ruth Buzzi dies at 88
item.description: Buzzi, who was best known for her regular appearances on the NBC variety TV show Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In, died on Thursday at her home in Texas.
item.content:encoded:
co-stars Ruth Buzzi and Gary Owens at NBC's 75th Anniversary Party, in Los Angeles, in 2002. Buzzi was best known for her regular appearances in the variety TV show during the late 1960s and early 70s.'/>

Buzzi, who was best known for her regular appearances on the NBC variety TV show Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In, died on Thursday at her home in Texas.

(Image credit: Rene Macura)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A telescope's powerful new tool may offer a better way to predict solar storms
item.description: The Daniel K. Inouye telescope snapped a clear image of sunspots.
item.content:encoded:
The Daniel K. Inouye telescope snapped a clear image of sunspots.

(Image credit: VTF/KIS/NSF/NSO/AURA)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Warren Buffett announces his retirement and warns the trade war will hurt America
item.description: The billionaire investor, now 94, also said he would be resigning as CEO at the end of the year. He spoke at Berkshire Hathaway's annual shareholder meeting known as "Woodstock for Capitalists."
item.content:encoded:
The billionaire investor, now 94, also said he would be resigning as CEO at the end of the year. He spoke at Berkshire Hathaway's annual shareholder meeting known as "Woodstock for Capitalists."

(Image credit: (AP Photo/Josh Funk))
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan
